translations: n.堡垒，[军]要塞（fort 的复数）
v.筑堡垒（fort 的三单形式）

phrs.translation: 劳德代尔堡（美国佛罗里达州东南沿海城市）

sentences.sentence: It also explains why some of the forts continued in occupation long after Rome ceased to have any formal authority in Britain.
sentences.translation: 这也解释了为什么罗马不再在英国拥有任何正式的权威之后，还有一些堡垒继续处于被占领的状态。

sentences.sentence: There was informal marriage with soldiers, who until A.D.197 were not legally entitled to wed, and whole new communities grew up near the forts.
sentences.translation: 在公元197年之前，士兵并未被法律授予结婚的权利，因此与士兵结婚没有正式的婚礼，而且所有的新社区都是在军事要塞附近发展起来的。

sentences.sentence: Smaller forts were once known as " fortalices ".
sentences.translation: 较小的堡垒曾经被称为“外堡”。
